comments.body: 100% agree. I just tried out the enchantment and found it to be so much fun, but I honestly don't see myself enchanting a netherite spear with lunge in survival if the durability cost is this high and especially if it means I'll have to spend netherite on an anvil or make a new one when the durability wears off.
This
And that
We want the lunge with mending exactly the crossbow make it better instead of removing the mending with lunge make something different which may a weakness for spear

Maybe not being compatible with mending could be a good thing since it's such a unique enchantment, but let's be real. The durability it costs to use it is way too high. And I also dont see myself repairing a netherite spear with an ingot. I would rather just not use lunge on the spear and put mending on it instead. Here are my solutions based on how important they are:
1.Reduce durability cost for using lunge enchantment
2.Make lunge enchantment compatible with mending
3.Introduce some other way to repair the spear (highly doubting this one)

I agree with this, because a wooden or gold spear breaks instantly with one use from Lunge 3. This needs to be balanced depending on weapon tiers:

This example is for Lunge 3 enchantment:

  • Wood: 4 durability used per lunge
  • Stone: 8 durability used per lunge
  • Iron: 16 durability used per lunge
  • Copper: 12 durability used per lunge
  • Gold: 2 durability used per lunge
  • Diamond: 98 durability used per lunge
  • Netherite: 127 durability used per lunge

This makes it worth it using Lunge 3 on weaker spears.

The thing that I find weird about them trying to overbalance Lunge is that Riptide on a Trident only reduces the durability by 1, and that allows you to travel much farther than Lunge does. The current implementation of the enchantment just heavily disincentives use of the Spear at all, since combat-wise it's much less useful than a Sword, you can't use it for mobility without your Spear just breaking, and the enchantment is incompatible with Mending.

They should be able to carry 2 double chests. This would help with inventory management and be an alternative to the wagon we've been wanting. 

They should have armor and a knockback similar to the enchantment that tosses away any mob that collides with them, letting them become a TANK (thereby fitting in the mayhem part of mobs of mayhem).

If they can hold a total of three players, then we have the count up from horse, camel, to happy ghast.

The sniffing rewards, that's nice! Maybe they should dig up sherds and trims in their respective structures? 

As for more plants, they should dig up an ancient sapling! Also weren't sniffer vines going to be a thing?

I think your ideas are incredible, bro. I like what you're proposing to add the ability to carry three players. That would be a good implementation so we could have different mobs with the possibility of carrying more players. I think what you're contributing would be a great improvement for the great sniffer tank, haha.

I've heard of so many potential upgrades for the sniffer, but this is the best by far!  It allows you to ride the sniffer while adding actual functionality even without lots of speed!  Not to mention how crazy all the theorists are going to be over the new lore implications!

sniffer detecting ruins would be surely cool help, maybe it could detect suspicious sand/gravel in general, which could then in return generate rarely out of main structures too with some general biom-based loot

that be done by riding sniffer is also nice idea, it being awfully slow mob also makes it not broken, as you would likely have to carry sniffer to area you want to investigate and check there, not using it as OP meta transport method, hence not limiting use of horses or elytra and happy ghast, in fact, it would improve use of horses/ghasts as they are best way to transport sniffer to place, rather than elytra many people consider too good, sniffer could also not be directly controlled like horse, but rather by lure on stick like strider/pig, maybe seeds sniffers eat, fishing rod and honey comb (so seeds are supposedly inside of wax to hold together on rod, which isnt as easy as with carrot or shroom, it also little more ties more mechanics together)

sniffer could not look for suspicious blocks/treasures/structures unless fed, if fed, it would only look for seeds (when not ridden), if oyu would feed it some specific item, it would then work as this "cold/hot" detector, it could be fed by seeds it is bred by, or if rod would be used to control it, right-clicking, like is speed for strider, could activate sniffing for structures for while at cost of durability
make them able to carry three players (or six? three on both sides?)
I also think you should be able to give them certain blocks and they will find them like an ominous banner to find a pillager outpost or a wood type or flower to find a specific biome
I know there are some of these suggestions in other categories like block,tools and items tho i think it should also be here as it fits perfectly with the updates theme.

This would be cool cuz the player could use the Nautilus as an early game thing for underwater but eventually they could get a full set of turtle armor and they could use that instead of nautilus being able bit easier to get around

You could go overboard and instead make the armor set Ocean themed.

  • Turtle helmet
  • Nautilus Leggings
  • Living Coral Armor
  • Fish Boots??? Maybe Guardian would work better.

I do like the logic of just using more turtle scutes, but I hope we get to brush them like the armadillo first. Otherwise, getting a full set could take a while. Apparently birds have scutes on their feet???

I got a real weird idea. A big turtle shell that you can either equip as a chest piece OR use in your off hand as a shield.

Or maybe it's just a shield but it stays on your back when your not blocking with it, giving you passive protection on top of your armor. Though it would be funny if this protection only applies to your back and nowhere else on your body.

""I got a real weird idea. A big turtle shell that you can either equip as a chest piece OR use in your off hand as a shield.""
maybe rather having actual turtle shield as separated item, not sure how to differentiate if from iron shield, but it could differ in durability or having some water-based benefits, maybe regular shield cant block guardian lasers and turtle one, can, or something, or having synergy of some kind with trident
turtle chest piece could provide back side protection, maybe having it like raised shield is (along with being disabled for time by axes or such means) while crouching, as to compensate for its potential OP status, it would slow down crouching significantly so you couldnt really "run" away from danger by crouching with this
turtle pants and boots could provide swimming speed bonus, not sure what else could fit those
Maybe to make it easier to get, you use the existing turtle shell helmet to upgrade leather armor on a smithing table requiring a new turtle upgrade smithing template?
Maybe obtaining a full set would give you unlimited water breathing etc

there's no need for this since you could just enchant your helmet with respiration and aqua affinity, and your boots with depth strider, I live on an island but I spend days in the water exploring underwater caves without water breathing since respiration III makes my air last so long all you have to do is mine out little air pockets to refill air every few minutes. but there is also water breathing potions that are not difficult to make at all
This is a fun idea, and would make the Nautilus more manoeuvrable in flooded caves. Maybe the player sits on the Nautilus when it has a saddle, but does this when it doesn't?

Maybe the player sits on the Nautilus when it has a saddle, but does this when it doesn't? 


Considering that the saddle model looks slightly different on all animals purely due to game conventions, the saddle on the nautilus could also be different and look like handrails.

Water is denser than air, and because of this, holding onto them should be more comfortable than sitting upright. Plus, the breathing effect looks a bit more logical this way.
Considering that they are able to give you infinite water breathing, I'm sure they can also make it comfortable to sit atop them and render the player less impacted by the water density
This is actually great, it's similar to the machine divers use that propels then forward

I made a post about this concern, I dont think it was approved though. :(

My idea was a little different and was that the player could be on the bottom and could hang from them while not swimming quick. Also i mentioned that dual weilding could be disabled.

But I COMPLETELY agree with this, Im voting on it. =)
I honestly think it'd be better to make the saddle look like it's just a handlebar strapped to the nautilus and have the player laying on the shell, that'd make it more realistic and look better
Cool idea. Makes more sense in every way
This would be so cool and make so much more sense than just sitting on its back and it somehow knowing where to go, and sitting on it looks a little cartoonish I think this would make it look cooler
I completely agree with the second comment on this post

When I heard we'd be swimming using the Nautilus, I imagined it would be like the Seaglide from Subnautica, and the player would be holding the sides of the Nautilus while it's propelling us forward. However, when it comes the building, sitting on it does make a sense. 

So in the words of that one early 2000's taco commercial:  Por que no los dos?

Have it be the first mob to have two different types of mounting.

The first being sitting on top of the shell, it's a lot slower but you can use both hands to place and break blocks. Less for traversal and more for building and combat.

The second being the player holding the sides of the shell. You can't use your hands, but the Nautilus can move a lot faster and even has better maneuverability, perfect for exploring the ocean and underwater caves.

Edit: I thought I was clever, someone else had the same idea, I probably should've read the other comments first lol.

this would make it look less odd and make a lot more sense. After all, how would you ride a giant nautilus? Sitting would most likely make the water lift you off because of the force when controlling the nautilus.
I think the drowned should also ride the zombie nautilus this way

That's a cool idea!
Mojang please proceed it
Would they add sandstone pillars for, like, the roman ruins you were talking about?
They could have new Bioluminescent biomes underwater, and maybe Deep drowneds or something
That sounds amazing but we've been waiting for an end up date for quite a while. And everyone would be more excited for an end update.
And barnacle! and when you go deeper then it gets darker and darker
I’d like if it required special armor or a potion of strength to be able to go so deep without being crushed. It could make prismarine shards more useful.
Yeah!new biome AND new mob?awsome
What if they also added full turtle armor or prismarine armor to withstand the deep ocean pressure

I agree, I think all oceans should generally get deeper by a bit, but only when they’re farther from shore (or in specific biomes) would they be like way deeper. Because then there’s a nice gradient, deeper oceans are slightly cooler, but also for people mining underground who happy to go slightly under an ocean, this shouldn’t inconvenience them

When I built an underwater structure, I found that sea is too shallow. In my opinion, I think the purpose of adding nautilus to Minecraft is to encourage users to build underwater structures. To do so, it is needed for Mojang to deepen the Deap Ocean.

Yeah, it'd be great to get some deeper oceans to match the new world height / depth. Like deep oceans are great and I love that they're split by temperature, but I think we need a third type of ocean that can spawn next to deep oceans and be even deeper, like going down to Y = 0. I don't know what this deeper scarier ocean biome could be called, but I think it would be an excellent location for the Barnacle from the mob vote and / or a new underwater structure.
Alternatively make it spawn there instead

Yeah, either change its name or have it spawn in the biome. Though personally, I'd prefer them to add another wolf variant for the pale garden called the pale wolf; since we have 12 cat breeds it would be nice to have another wolf breed (10 total).

The Pale Wolf could simply be named the Classic Grey Wolf. This name refers to the iconic Minecraft wolf variant used for many years, and therefore that name avoids any relation to the pale garden biome.
I think, at the very least, they should remove the durability cost of the enchantment when not hitting anything, so that one can jump around with it without destroying their weapon on the air itself.
It does not work with mending for some reason. Was testing in my superflat world set to survival. Can not put both on.

It turns out Lunge works great as a great movement tool that is very accessible in the early to mid game, Especially the 2 and up levels of the enchantment paired with wood tier spear and its fast attack cooldown, creates an terrific Jump-Dash combination that's an extremely fun skill based method of traversal and parkour. Unfortunately the current durability penalty can consume the lower tier spears in just few uses, making the setup useless in survival gameplay. Removing or Altering how the durability penalty is handled would remedy the issue and make the lunge enchantment the explorer's new best friend. 

For the alternative ways of handling thee durability i propose:

the durability penalty scaling with the weapon tier instead of enchantment tier as it is now, the heavier the spear the more durability lunge consumes with wood consuming almost none and ntherite consuming the most, maybe even more than the current penalty. (logically consistent as all the spear tiers share the same handle material so it makes sense that heavier tips would put more strain on the humble stick)

Durability being consumed on dealing damage and hitting a block (rather intuitive as it would be consistent with the way other tools handle, and also "why would it be damaged from literally poking the air?")
I suggest leaving the 8-durability cost for Lunge I as is, but level II and III should only cost 16 and 32 instead. Double the costs instead of quadrupling them.

Why should launching yourself a few blocks forwards cost 128 durability? Keep in mind that Lunge adds no extra damage to the jab attack, you're just paying up to 128 durability to launch yourself a few blocks forwards. They need to:

  • Make the lunge cancel vertical speed if you're falling so you hang in the air for longer, and
  • Remove or massively decrease the durability cost (Lunge 3 should cost no more than 8 durability), and
  • Make the lunge add bonus damage to the jab
Lunge should at least be compatible with mending, that would make the durability cost somewhat bearable
On YouTube someone said that the lunge should take hunger instead of durability which I agree with. That and making mending usable with it.
I disagree with Mending making it bearable, you’re just moving the problem back and making yourself farm XP to repair the tool. It’s slightly better but not a solution to making lunge viable imo

Please make lunge compatible with mending at least, even if that makes the obnoxious cost stay the same. Costing a netherite ingot to repair the spear after every few lunges will make it a completely unviable option in survival/hardcore world.

My proposed values for damage would be:

2 or 4 damage for Lunge I

4 or 8 damage for Lunge II

8 to 16 damage for Lunge III

It's definitely wayyyy too high right now </3
The latest snapshot has made mending usable with it but still like 60 lunges break your netherite spear.
i agree
The crab is cool, but the only reason ANYONE wants the penguin is bc people like penguins. It isn't really necessary.
i saw an idea where the penguin would drop feathers that could be used to make a sled. i realy like this idea
I want both mobs, but lets not pretend that the crab actually fits in this updates theme.
Sounds like a good idea :)
YES. literally "Mounts of Mayhem" XD
Also piglins on striders maybe :D
how about crossbow piglins riding ghasts
this doesn't seem to fit since they hunt hoglins
You're somehow right but I don't want to witness this situzation again.
you are correct but we really don't need a repeat of the last time this happened...
Just change it to fishes. Nautilus can eat fishes irl.

The thing is Nautilus and Pufferfish are not something your average joe has access to unlike frogs and fireflies. Plus Minecraft nautilus are clearly more fantasy inspired. I don't think they should change it.

Oooooooh!!!! Good point! New firefly-and-frog situation here! It’s safe to say that Mojang is no longer animal-friendly. Slime and magma are worse to frogs than fireflies, dogs can eat SPOILED MEAT, and the Nautilus, an animal UNDER THE RISK OF EXTINCTION, is tamed with what is otherwise poison (to both humans and nautili).

How is a normal child supposed to access a Nautilus? Not only are they extremely rare, but they are also:

  • illegal to hunt in the United States and other countries being a protected species.
  • only found in the deep waters of the tropical Pacific and Indian Oceans.
  • not a suitable pet for a home aquarium hobbyists, more or less children.
They eat dead fish, crabs, shrimp, lobsters, (other crustaceans). They are scavangers that dig through the seabed searching for food.
Following this logic, the ability to ride them should also be removed. That would harm them in real life!
Its video game childern well not gone to the sea and make nautilus eat pufferfish, the same situation with frog and firefly is gone to happen now

JELLYFISH. I TELL YOU, JELLYFISH.
Jellyfish can also have their own uses. Heh, the Gel.

It can be used to coat torches for it to be placed down underwater, however, the best part, you can also coat redstone with it, allowing for underwater redstone contraptions.
don't put that into the universe!
BRO DON'T DO IT; THE PUFFERFISH WILL GET REMOVED. THE ITEM WILL GET REMOVED JUST LIKE THE FIREFLY, BRO. DON'T SAY IT!

Strongly disagree here. In the Live, it was stated the Pufferfish thing is following "Minecraft Logic"-- that being, Pufferfish mean Water Breathing. And so, it's not real life logic, it's Minecraft Logic. I hope it remains this way-- Pufferfish are a much cooler item to feed the Nautilus mob than Kelp or Seagrass. We need more of this, because situations like Cows, Sheep, Llamas, Goats,and Mooshrooms all use Wheat to breed, which is too many mobs for one food in my opinion.

Let us not repeat what happened with fireflies. These clearly are giant fantasy nautiluses and not those we'd find out in the water.

Though if you WANT to raise awarness, I would make it so the different foods have a lower chance but using pufferfish also inflicts debuffs like poison and slowness, encouraging more experienced players to be more mindful when feeding it.

Its most likely going to happen the samething as with frogs. 

First players: We want a new mob! Mojang adds the mob. Players doesnt like what the mob does/eats. Mojang changes it so that it is, lets says more stupid than before.
Second Mojang: We do a lot of research before adding something. And then this happens... I thought Mojang cant add a mob that is more useless than the happy ghast. Well Mojang taught me wrong. When are they going to listen to the community?!

The ability to ride them is fine because these are a massive variant from hundredthousands of years ago. So I do not see the problem, it is a videogame and therefore it does not need to perfectly mirror reality. Only needs to be believable.

Happy Ghast is one of the most useful mobs in the game. You can transport multiple boats with it using ropes and have mobs in those boats or just connect the mobs directly. Only drawback is its speed.
This would be a good opportunity to add the crab tho.

I think the best way to fix this would be to rename the Nautilus to the Ammonite, as making it an extinct animal rather than a living one would be less confusing to younger players, and fit more with the fantasy exception that Mojang said they would make for the Nautilus mob
Mojang, don't take out pufferfish like you did the poor firefly--just make it so Nautilises just attack fish instead!
“Very sadly we are removing the pufferfish”
I was thinking the same thing!
I was also thinking the same thing, but this should also work on the zombie horses!
Maybe you feed the Zombie Nautilus a “Golden Pufferfish” of sorts, and it would become a “Golden Nautilus” which goes much faster!
Would depend on how rare the nautilus is and if they make the zombie nautilus drop its shell..
I think the perfect cure for a Zombie Nautilus would be the Heart of the Sea.
Dr. Thezbi Kazo approves of this idea
There would probably need to be a cure for camel husks if they included this.
It would be funny if to cure the Camel Husk, you make them drink a bucket of water.

I wish there was a way to cure the zombie nautilus, especially considering that the zombie version has the Coral reef variant that should be able to be cured for the same variant but on a regular Nautilus.
Spears should also have more range. Maybe that could make these wither skeletons outrange us if we dont use spear to counter theirs. That interaction could make this weapon really useful.

Totally agree. More diversity in the Wither Skeletons would make them harder, and it could punish the age-old "place a block and they can't get under", with the Skeleton just spearing you with the longer range. I think you should have to fight, not cheese, these monsters.
Acho a ideia muito boa, uma ideia que eu tenho também é de esquetos Wither com arco poderiam atira flechas de fogo.
They should show up with Wither Skeleton Horses
They could also have a shield.
Honestly wither skeletons are already hard to deal with, so no.
For wolf armor too!

I think protection enchantments should be 2.5x as effective maxing out at 40% damage reduction for protection and 80% for the other types. It would also give an actual reason to use one of the other types of protection on a horse.

yes, yes yes, horses need a lot more protection, especially because how insanely hard is to get generally good horse by combinaiton of insane luck and breeding efforts, most players dont even bother with this, random arrows and creepers exploding can easily kill horse with even decent max health, creepers 1-shot horses on hard difficulty

we want option to upgrade diamond horse armor into netherite, it is tier of armor we are missing, except chainmail one (which could be cool collectible from villages or making it exclusively from zombie/skeleton horse riders, that is unrelated anyway), netherite horse armor tier is first thing they should had announced/shown wile talking/showing how horses may be used with spears, it makes sense for gear progression, it would be fully optional thing, you can be equipped in netherite, but your horse cant, thus you cant match your styles

enchanting horse armor would be great too, only enchantments I would let to be put on them are protection ones (mutually exclusive as they should be) and maybe stuff as thorns, feather falling, depth strider but not frost walker (because whole thing with "boat is for this" thing), since it is single piece, efficiency of such enchantment would be reduced, maybe saddles could be enchanted as well with protection or as suggested below, horse armor having protection bonuses more powerful
Agreed. All while I was watching Minecraft Live, I kept thinking "wait, did that just hit?" It needs to be more distinguished.
This is also a good opportunity to fix Bedrock's heart system. It's supposed to flash white more than once like on Java, but they don't at all.
The 'critical hit ' particle effect should work for it
well I mean it was recorded on Bedrock so let's see how it will look in the actual game
I agree-- I think adding particles to hits, and adding a "smash/impact" sound would be good. I expect we will see it though, the Mace got it.
Yes! Dr. Thezbi Kazo Supportes this idea.
Perhaps the spear could point slightly in the direction of the mob getting hit?
Do you mean anticlimactic?
I think this is a very great idea!
LOVE IT!!!!!!!
Please, I hate "mining deserts". I don't want to be forced to destroy the world for glass and concrete.

All this does is make Conduits even more redundant when a much more common source of the effect exists, aka the Nautilus mob, especially when Conduit Power also gives things like speed boost and underwater vision.

I do agree that having a new effect that's similar to it is just needless bloat, they could've just made Nautilus give Water Breathing effect when they're practically the exact same.
Conduits could give multiple affects. Prehaps nautilus should pause breathing in a limited way or being dependent on bubble colomn proximity.

Merging the effects would not be a good idea because they do not serve the same purpose. The Nautilus Mob is meant to be an early game version of the Conduit. Early game meaning it can't come with ALL the features, it needs to be limited. Like the Bundle or Happy Ghast or Suspicious Stews. The Nautilus is designed to give you better access to the Conduit. Which, when combined with the proper infrastructure, can become a permanent fixture for new underwater settlements rather than a temporary solution.
I disagree. Why someone would use conduit when you can have Nautilus?

they could make it tiered and have level 1 be from riding nautiluses which only pauses the oxygen bar while level 2 which comes from conduits replenish the oxygen bar, while also giving night vision and haste as part of it

Agree, and also the conduit could have a secondary power that acts somewhat like a beacon. It could give Aqua Affinity to players in range or increase their swimming speed as well as its current effects.

This would keep the conduit from becoming redundant, narrow down the achievement requirements (for How Did We Get Here as OP said), and incentivize players to use this item. Increased swim speed or aqua affinity would be great for building underwater, for example.
They literally didn't change this...?
They literally did. I use horses constantly so I absolutely recognize a massive difference in how they move. Thanks for your input though I guess?

I thought it was just me. It has to be a bug. Because in Java, The horse and Camel still move normally. Heck, I was using my horse in bedrock before the update dropped. And after? It’s clunky and slow to respond.

Hopefully they fix this, kind of hard to joust when the moving is unresponsive. Hopefully they release a bug fix patch like usual in the coming days. 👍

I'm the one from the first reply. Didn't know about this cuz I play on Java and also use the horse pretty frequently and it seemed to be exactly the same. I didn't see anything in the changelogs of any beta or snapshot so yeah, this is likely a bug... Hope they fix it soon then.
I edited to add that it's bedrock. Didn't realize this forum was for both versions
Yes I noticed this too. This is the only thing online I can find mentioning it. Lowkey makes riding horses unbearable
not only are horses being affected, but also powered rail travel is bugged as well for bedrock. i hope they fix these soon. The bedrock community needs to collectively bring more attention to this.

I spent a lot of time working on horse infrastructure and breeding up fast horses. This nee update makes my primary means of transport unusable :( It should be reverted. I’d rather have to dismount in water than ruin their movement.
I’m getting the same on my Bedrock realm and have experienced this to be worse with boats, making boats and horses unusable.

I am having the same problem with horses and boats. There was a new update today and was hoping this would fix it but it didn’t. Horses and boats are still very lagging. It’s hard to get around without the constant lag

I'm having this exact same issue with horses and boats on my realm. I never had this issue prior to the update and now on both my Nintendo Switch and Xbox Series S the movement is super laggy when using boats and horses.

I tried closing and reopening my realm, making sure the server connection was as close to me as possible and that my connection was stable. The issue definitely seems to be with the update and I'm at a loss of what to do. The game is essentially unplayable right now.

So found out today that this was supposedly done on purpose, even though Java didn't get the "improvement". Go comment to add your voice that this isn't a wanted change!

https://report.bugs.mojang.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/6/MCPE-231719

This is seriously such a useless thing they did that they need to fix, all I wanted to do was ride a horse a small distance and it was so difficult to stay on the paths I made because of they delayed movement. It was one thing when they made horses take fall damage but now horses just make your movement worse
Agreed. Please revert the Bedrock horse movement (or at least allow the option to) to the pre-update movement. The new horse movement feels terrible and laggy. It makes horses no fun to ride.
Yes horses, are game changing for old worlds built around their movement.  Improve them.  (First post ever to complain about something.)
The jumping is also messed up now, there is a weird delay.

Idk if its just me since no one else has mentioned it but I noticed the lagginess also applies to the happy ghast's movement. It's been almost a month so it's crazy something this significant hasn't been fixed yet

Then by that logic you should also be able to attack faster with any weapon, the shield should have less cooldown and bows and crossbows should shoot faster. This is just kinda too much, spears are already op.
Dr. Thezbi Kazo approves of this idea
or an enchantment of lightness? for the spear
Don't see why this shouldn't be the case, every other skeleton variant already spawns in trial chambers (bogged were even added for that express purpose) so I'd love to see this implemented soon.
Way more people should be voting for this.

just a reminder for mojang that don't forget to add the new skeleton to the trial chambers.

come on don't be afraid of make little arrangements to world generation on game drops. that's why we decide to update and continue playing the game after 15 years: the changes that are consistent and compatible with all the world.
Yes
would be interesting, especially as camel rider could still be programed to be able to use rush/jump thing camels have, giving properly different danger between bioms
They added it :)
maybe the idle holding pose could have it to where the spear is vertical so this could work, the crafting recipe should just be the spear next to a banner
Dr Thezbi Kazo supports this idea
w idea
well, boats are cheap and are way faster than the nautilus, so it's still useful, but this would make it better.
Penguin is useless
You can not transport the nautilus around thou, so boats are still amazing. Also you can transport mobs with them.

I wouldnt call boats, literally best huge cargo/mob transport method for me for exploration, as "useless", nautilus cant carry chests (yet) and as such boats with chests and other boats with chests tied to it by lead will not lose relevancy even if nautilus will be faster
however, adding penguins would be always good idea just because penguins are penguins
I would probably even prefer them to rework initial idea behind them similar as they did with copper golem, so they do something else, or more than just speed up boats, but what they could do other than what was told in mob vote video, I am not sure
Like the spear helps with combat in horses, crabs would give more range for building, which helps while on a happy ghast or a nautilus, so it fits perfectly.
Why do people do not check if this or something similar has already been posted? Why the spam?
I think they might add it, it just probably wasn't announced as a surprise

I 100% agree.

Realms have been my default play method for years, as I play Minecraft almost exclusively with non-local family.

All of the sudden, boats and horses are just completely useless. Even with addons to help guide travel, it’s ludicrously onerous to cover and significant amount of distance.

I recently started my first vanilla survival work via realms and my favorite thing is to explore on horseback and boat, filling out my map collection. The horse and boat are both so jittery that I get motion sickness. I thought it would be a temporary bug, but now I am devastated to learn we have to live with it. This change has destroyed a completely acceptable mode of play and my experience.
I am upvoting every post that says this and have made my own on this. We need to make noise until Mojang listens. They want to shove this under the rug, we can’t let them.

Boats can be horrendously painful to travel by. Especially on Bedrock.
We've faced this issue on realms and a server now.

I'm so sad this bug is considered intended behavior 😭
I sat on my horse in our Aternos server and the input delay was crazy. I then tried on a single player world (brand new) and the delay was still there, but a bit less.
I want to be able to use my horse. Please Mojang, fix this
Can someone share a link to the closed issue calling it intended behavior?  That's just mind boggling.

Boats are now totally unusable on realms on the switch. They are the easiest long distance transport for early gaming especially exploring and map creation. Was this just not tested? It's destroyed the game play.
It’s not even just Realms. I’m in a single player world and suddenly my boats are way too laggy to use.

As requested by a previous comment, the bug report is named MCPE-231719 with the title "Horse, Donkey, Mule and Boat movement is extremely sluggish, delayed, and visually unstable". The bug report is uploaded on the website mojira dot dev, and is for whatever reason super difficult to find by using a search engine.

I found out that horse/boat/mount lag probably stems from a deeper issue. This can be found in bug report MCPE-179969 with the name "Models lag in following entities", again on mojira dot dev. Feel free to read the comments on that bug report to know more, and how this affects the mounts.
I would like to say it's not just realms but also SINGLE PLAYER WORLDS TOO, and this whole update is supposed to be MOUNTS OF MAYHEM?????????????????? It is so buggy to be on any mount
Love the idea of the new update, but as it is, boats and horses, etc. are completely unusable. The game is super smooth until hopping in the boat, then the lag and stutter effect kicks in full gear.

I cant understand why Mojang would actively make their game worse and when called out for it just shrug their shoulders and say 'Live with it' The way boats behave makes the game almost unplayable. It makes exploration (one of the BIG reasons to play) tedious and difficult. Boourns

me and 2 other players just spent literally a hour or more getting a horse from one spot(spawn area) acrossed 2 maps what would (pre update) usually take maybe 2 Minecraft days. took us instead and actual over and hour and a half cause we had to keep stoping and leading my horse when it came to bridges or over water ways or ealse id end up off the road in water or pit even though my remote is sitting in my lap. the update has ruined our main mode of travel. even the notolis in the water is horrible right now. we have a huge relm we have had for years. so we need the horses, boats what ever to get places. this is crazy.
